['', 'Excellent oral and written communication skills', 'In this role, you will help our team interpret the performance data gathered from our write and read pipelines with statistical analysis and modeling.\xa0', 'Experience in a non-Academic/non-research environment', 'Develop statistical models to predict performance, troubleshoot experiments, and answer “what if” questions', 'What you want:', 'Experience in developing cloud-based analysis pipelines in Python or in similar languages', 'Experience with analysis of NGS, imaging, or sensor data\xa0', 'Develop simulators to support strategic proof-of-concept demonstrations in DNA storage and computing', 'The challenge of modeling large heterogeneous data about software, hardware, and chemistry', 'Apply machine learning to address analysis bottlenecks', 'Define and implement an automated data analysis pipeline to complement our core pipelines', 'What we need:', 'Facility with at least one cloud-based machine learning framework', 'An MS or PhD in applied statistics or a related field', 'Work with the world’s fastest DNA data storage writer', 'What you will do:', 'At Catalog, we value perseverance, leadership, teamwork, science, and communication. You will have the opportunity to shape the future of an entirely new way of manipulating information. You will have a chance to formulate and solve challenging computing problems arising in this uncharted territory. You will have a chance to work and learn with a team of talented scientists, engineers, and entrepreneurs, and a chance to wear multiple hats and grow with us.\xa0', 'Experience in developing statistical models to explain hardware, chemical, or biological dataExperience in developing cloud-based analysis pipelines in Python or in similar languagesExperience with analysis of NGS, imaging, or sensor data\xa0Facility with at least one cloud-based machine learning frameworkExcellent oral and written communication skillsAn MS or PhD in applied statistics or a related fieldExperience in a non-Academic/non-research environment', 'Communicate results to a cross disciplinary audience', 'Experience in developing statistical models to explain hardware, chemical, or biological data', 'Work with a cross disciplinary team of scientists and engineers to analyze data gathered from our core pipelinesDevelop statistical models to predict performance, troubleshoot experiments, and answer “what if” questionsDevelop simulators to support strategic proof-of-concept demonstrations in DNA storage and computingDefine and implement an automated data analysis pipeline to complement our core pipelinesApply machine learning to address analysis bottlenecksCommunicate results to a cross disciplinary audience', 'An opportunity to define the analysis pipeline for DNA data storage and computing', 'Work with a cross disciplinary team of scientists and engineers to analyze data gathered from our core pipelines', 'Work with the world’s fastest DNA data storage writerAn opportunity to define the analysis pipeline for DNA data storage and computingThe challenge of modeling large heterogeneous data about software, hardware, and chemistryA culture of excellence embedded in a collegial and supportive environmentResponsibility, leadership, and trust', 'We hope that you will consider joining us for a chat; we promise it will be intriguing.', 'A culture of excellence embedded in a collegial and supportive environment', 'Responsibility, leadership, and trust', "At Catalog, we are building the world's first massive data storage and computing platform using DNA as the storage medium. As an information storage medium, DNA is unique in its stability over millennia (think fossils), information density (gigabits in a cellular volume), and replicability (billions of copies, made cheaply and efficiently). Among its many groundbreaking applications, these properties make DNA an attractive medium for high density storage of latency tolerant data and massively parallel computation. To this end, we are developing a novel exabyte-scale DNA computing platform and looking for motivated engineers to join us."]

['', 'Previous programming experience in Scala', 'Leading Autonomous Driving Company', '\xa0', 'SF Bay Area', '5-7 years’ experience in a previous Data Engineering role or Software Engineering, Big Data roleProficient in Python and SQLPrevious programming experience in ScalaPrevious experience working in a Hadoop eco-system (Spark, HDFS)Experience working with multiple cloud technologies (AWS, GCP, AZURE)', 'Requirements:', 'Working with vast amounts of structured and unstructured data', 'Implementing big data frameworks such as Hive and Impala', 'Designing and Developing ETL tools', 'One of the fastest-growing and most innovative Autonomous Driving Technology companies is actively looking to add a Senior Data Engineer on their Analytics team.\xa0As part of a newly developed Engineering team, you will work on designing and building out the AWS data pipeline to fuel the company along its digital journey. The ideal candidate will be a self-starter with superior communication skills (verbal and written).\u202fA solid understanding of data science, advanced statistics, machine learning, data mining and visualization techniques are a must. In addition to the following qualifications, the desire and ability to learn quickly is vital.', 'Maintaining data platform and managing computing infrastructure', 'Senior Data Engineer - Analytics', '5-7 years’ experience in a previous Data Engineering role or Software Engineering, Big Data role', 'Experience working with multiple cloud technologies (AWS, GCP, AZURE)', 'Salary: $180 - $200k + Bonus and Equity', 'Proficient in Python and SQL', 'Maintaining data platform and managing computing infrastructureWorking with vast amounts of structured and unstructured dataImplementing big data frameworks such as Hive and ImpalaDesigning and Developing ETL tools', 'Previous experience working in a Hadoop eco-system (Spark, HDFS)', 'The future Sr. Data Engineer will be responsible for:']

', 'ASCII Group LLC', 'NoSQL Datastore (MongoDB, Change Data Capture) ', '\xa0', 'Experience architecting container-based microservice using Java 11, Spring, Spring Boot NoSQL Datastore (MongoDB, Change Data Capture) Experience in Containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), CI/CD, GIT, Artifactory, package the application as a Kubernetes microservice. ['', 'Development experience in Apache Spark', 'Develop and expand our capabilities to search and access our vehicle data', 'Build analytics tools for surfacing actionable insights into our vehicle performance', 'Voyage is delivering on the promise of self-driving cars.', 'Self-starter: able to adapt to emerging challenges and execute under ambiguity', 'Experience using AWS cloud services', 'Work with stakeholders across various teams to identify, design, and implement additional features and improvements to fulfill their data needs', 'Requirements:', 'Ownership of all things dataDevelop and expand our vehicle data pipeline that processes terabytes of data per dayWork on infrastructure for surfacing and processing training data for machine learning purposesBuild analytics tools for surfacing actionable insights into our vehicle performanceDevelop and expand our capabilities to search and access our vehicle dataWork with stakeholders across various teams to identify, design, and implement additional features and improvements to fulfill their data needsBe a "data advocate" across the company and helping various teams understand the data that is available and how to effectively access it', 'Familiarity with workflow orchestration frameworks (ex: Airflow)', '5+ years of experience building large-scale data pipelinesExperience writing production-level code with Python and/or node.jsStrong SQL knowledgeExperience using AWS cloud servicesDevelopment experience in Apache SparkFamiliarity with workflow orchestration frameworks (ex: Airflow)Self-starter: able to adapt to emerging challenges and execute under ambiguity', '5+ years of experience building large-scale data pipelines', "Voyage has built the technology and services to bring autonomous transportation to those who need it most, beginning in retirement communities. Whether residents face mobility restrictions or just want to take a ride, Voyage takes pride in getting all our passengers to their destination safely, efficiently, and affordably. Our journey begins in calmer communities, but we won't stop until anyone, anywhere can summon a Voyage.", 'Develop and expand our vehicle data pipeline that processes terabytes of data per day', 'Ownership of all things data', 'Work on infrastructure for surfacing and processing training data for machine learning purposes', 'Responsibilities:', 'Experience writing production-level code with Python and/or node.js', 'Autonomous vehicles collect large amounts of data on a daily basis. The biggest challenge is making it easily accessible across various functions, such as analytics for tracking vehicle performance, queryable sensor data for engineers, training data for machine learning, etc. Your primary responsibility will be to own the data processing pipeline to allow us to ingest, process, and expose the large amounts of data that we’re collecting.', 'Be a "data advocate" across the company and helping various teams understand the data that is available and how to effectively access it', 'Strong SQL knowledge']

['', '- Willing to learn/use Python and/or Go.\xa0Experience with any language, no preference.', '- Working on the Ethereum virtual machine.', '- 80% spent implementing arbitrage for those protocols against existing protocols they support.', 'Nice to have:', "The company is seeking engineers who will research and implement new arbitrage strategies that will become renewable income streams.\xa0The codebase is mostly in Python and Go, and you would be programming in either one of those (whatever you prefer).\xa0They don't require experience with any particular programming language or technology as long as you are willing to learn whatever is needed, have solid knowledge of CS fundamentals, and a passion for blockchain and/or trading.", '- Passion for trading and/or blockchain and/or cryptocurrency.', 'Location: Remote', 'The company will pay very competitive salary (up to $250k), plus very significant equity (anywhere from 1-10% depending on how much salary you prefer) which could be very lucrative.', 'Software Engineer - Blockchain Arbitrage Firm', '- Solid CS fundamentals.', 'Qualifications:', 'The company is seeking to hire several engineers in the next few months. The company is remote/distributed and you would be working 100% remotely.', '- Experience with blockchain.', '- Skill in math including calculus.', 'Job Responsibilities:', 'The company is led by industry veterans in the blockchain and cryptocurrency trading space.\xa0The company is a leader in the cryptocurrency arbitrage market, and has multiplied the value of its holdings by 12x in 6 months.', '- 10% spent on researching new protocols on Ethereum.', '- 10% writing tests.\xa0Also possibly accounting for money they make.\xa0For example, they had to write an accounting program to comply with applicable laws.', '- Experience with trading.', '- The codebase is mostly Python, some Go. they may do more Go work in the future.', 'The company also has great work life balance. Their technology enables them to literally make money while they sleep, and they work about 35 hours/week.']

files.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Experience supporting data science activities using FAIR data management and reproducible practices.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Contribute to the broader leadership.', 'Note: Targeting a software engineering background, not data scientist. : if you have strong software engineering and R background and some technical domain knowledge in biology, you will be a strong fit', 'Requirements', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Familiarity with\xa0genomics and BioConductor packages and data structures are a plus.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Adept at object-oriented programming, with proficiency in R, Python, C++ or Java.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Collaborate with local and off-shore engineering teams to support your software development efforts.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Work with business analysts, computational scientists, and other\xa0software engineers to understand and conceptualize the complex, emerging needs of our scientists, whether they are working at the keyboard or the bench.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0You are enthusiastic about working in a scientific environment, especially one that is related to drug discovery and development.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Demonstrated ability to lead heterogeneous engineering teams and interface with domain experts and users.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0BS or higher in bioinformatics, computer science or related field.', 'In addition,']

job_title: Data Scientist, Signal Processing (South San Francisco, CA)
job_text: ['', 'Develop quality control and pre-processing tools for a broad range of digital data types.', 'Python or similar.', 'Minimum qualifications:', ' Python or similar. Exploratory and statistical data analysis (such as linear models, multivariate analysis, predictive modeling and stochastic models). Experience extracting and cleaning data sets. Physiological signal processing and analysis of time-series data. Machine learning (supervised and unsupervised methods). ', 'Demonstrated willingness to both teach others and learn new techniques.', 'Familiarity with Deep Learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch etc.).', ' Masters degree in Computer Science or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience. 3+ Years experience with: Python or similar. Exploratory and statistical data analysis (such as linear models, multivariate analysis, predictive modeling and stochastic models). Experience extracting and cleaning data sets. Physiological signal processing and analysis of time-series data. Machine learning (supervised and unsupervised methods).   ', 'Work with large, complex data sets in the sleep domain. Solve difficult, non-routine analysis problems, handling data challenges from a real-world setting.', 'Responsibilities', 'Qualifications', '3+ Years experience with: Python or similar. Exploratory and statistical data analysis (such as linear models, multivariate analysis, predictive modeling and stochastic models). Experience extracting and cleaning data sets. Physiological signal processing and analysis of time-series data. Machine learning (supervised and unsupervised methods).  ', 'Description', 'Machine learning (supervised and unsupervised methods).', 'PhD degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., biomedical engineering, computer science, applied mathematics or similar) or equivalent practical experience.', 'Exploratory and statistical data analysis (such as linear models, multivariate analysis, predictive modeling and stochastic models). Experience extracting and cleaning data sets.', 'Solid Data Science Python experience (NumPy, SciPy, Pandas, Scikit-Learn, Matplotlib etc.).', 'Familiarity with software engineering practices and experience developing production software.', '2+ years of relevant work experience (i.e., as a biomedical engineer, data scientist, computational biologist), including deep expertise and experience with cardiac signal processing.', 'Apply advanced analytical methods that process continuously measured physiological and cardiac features in a real-world population.', 'Physiological signal processing and analysis of time-series data.', 'Masters degree in Computer Science or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.', 'Clearly communicate highly technical results and methods in well structured presentations/reports, as well as interact cross-functionally with a wide variety of people and teams.', ' Work with large, complex data sets in the sleep domain. Solve difficult, non-routine analysis problems, handling data challenges from a real-world setting. Develop quality control and pre-processing tools for a broad range of digital data types. Iterate on and build new models from wearable sensors using a combination of physical modeling, signal processing and machine learning approaches. Apply advanced analytical methods that process continuously measured physiological and cardiac features in a real-world population. Clearly communicate highly technical results and methods in well structured presentations/reports, as well as interact cross-functionally with a wide variety of people and teams. ', 'Experience with the analysis of wearable sensors and clinical data.', ' 2+ years of relevant work experience (i.e., as a biomedical engineer, data scientist, computational biologist), including deep expertise and experience with cardiac signal processing. Experience with the analysis of wearable sensors and clinical data. Solid Data Science Python experience (NumPy, SciPy, Pandas, Scikit-Learn, Matplotlib etc.). Familiarity with software engineering practices and experience developing production software. Demonstrated willingness to both teach others and learn new techniques. Familiarity with Deep Learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch etc.). PhD degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., biomedical engineering, computer science, applied mathematics or similar) or equivalent practical experience.', 'Iterate on and build new models from wearable sensors using a combination of physical modeling, signal processing and machine learning approaches.', 'Preferred qualifications:']

[' Need help finding the right job? ', "Do you dare to reinvent the future of education? At Cengage, we're harnessing the power of tech to build a future where all learners have the tools and confidence to achieve their goals. As a Cengage employee, you'll be helping to transform the way people learn. Collaborating with the best of the best, you'll feel challenged and inspired to do breakthrough work. Together, there's no limit to what we can imagine, create and innovate! Are we right for you? We set the bar higher by bringing our unique talents and points of view to the table every day. We're curious and comfortable with change and are willing to take risks to transform education for the better. Most importantly, we put learning first with everything we do. We also offer a fun, challenging, and rewarding environment with the opportunity to work with some of the most talented people in our industry.What You'll Do HereAs an Associate Software Engineer at Cengage, you’ll be hands-on, writing lots of code and interacting with developers across the organization. You will be helping us build out the next revision of our LMS Integrations application and will join a team that is working on new technologies for providing digital access to Cengage content. This role will involve:situations. Pair programming with other team members in a variety of situations.  Continuously learning; being unafraid to learn new practices, processes, technologies, and languages.  A commitment to completing well-defined work, and then delivering on those commitments.  Helping to plan, estimate, and provide just-in-time designs for small increments of work.  Ensuring the best possible user experience for our end users, passing them onto their content in as seamless a way as possible.  Taking security seriously in everything you do, thinking about and ensuring that we protect student and instructor data in everything we do, including every aspect of the SDLC. Skills You Will Need Here Must have a strong teamwork orientation and the ability to collaborate within and across teams.  Knowledge of- and desire to work in an Agile/Lean development environment.  Ability to test-drive clean, quality code, and work closely with other Agile team members.  Ability to help drive tasks to completion.  Ability to perform root cause analysis, technology evaluation, and design spikes.  Testing knowledge and a keen eye for edge cases.  Enthusiasm to learn and grow.  Java knowledge is a plus. Required Education And Experience Minimum 1-2 years software development experience using JavaScript/TypeScript and ReactJS.  A bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or a related field. job_title: Software Engineer (Data Applications), Remote Opportunity Av - CO8561088
job_text: ['Atlanta;TX', 'Austin;CO', 'Denver;MN', 'Des MoinesCareer Category: Recent College Graduate,Experienced ProfessionalFull/Part Time: Full-TimeRegular/Temporary: RegularDate Posted: 2020-09-28What you\'ll doOur Enterprise Data and Applications team is building a 360-degree view of ourcustomers to enable analytics, business intelligence, and data pipelinesacross the enterprise. We are looking for a Software Engineer with a passionfor data to join our product team and help design, build, and support ourenterprise analytics ecosystem. The team works in a Kanban environment,largely utilizing DevOps practices. If you enjoy solving complex problems in ahighly collaborative environment, please consider applying today!You\'ll have the opportunity to:Design and implement reliable and efficient data-pipelines from ingestion toconsumption.Develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines that test and deploy software,data, and infrastructure artifacts across managed environments.Integrate data from a variety of systems into refined data products availableto the rest of the enterprise.Collaborate with highly skilled and motivated product-focused individuals.Work directly with stakeholders to optimize existing solutions and architectnew ones to meet functional and non-functional requirements.Experiment with new technologies and practices to find creative solutions tocomplex problems.This role will require on-call rotation.What you\'ll get from usCompetitive pay, benefits, perks and more. We\'ll reward you for theskills and experience you have.Respect for your unique perspective. Diversity, inclusion and empowermentare at the core of our culture.A career, not just a job. Principal is a place where you can learn andinnovate. Do important work. Make an impact. And achieve your professionalgoals.The ability to have a great job and a great life. Sure, work is important.But so is your family. And your friends. And your community. That\'s why weprovide the flexibility needed to find the right balance between your job andthe rest of your life.QualificationsAssociate\'s or Bachelor\'s degree with a preference in a science,technology, engineering, or math (STEM) related field or equivalentwork experience (6 years of experience equates to an Associate\'s degreewhen defining "equivalent work experience")Object oriented software or data engineering experience (professional,academic, or community exposure)Strongest candidates will have 2years of professional technology experienceand exposure to many of the "preferred" skills/technologies listed belowAdditional preferred technical experience/skills:Programming languages such as Scala, Java, PythonFamiliarity with Hadoop-related tooling such as Spark, Hive, Kafka,Flume, etc.Ability to write SQL queries and interpret data modelsVersion control tooling (Git)Traditional and NOSQL data stores such as Hadoop, DB2 LUW, etc.ETL (Informatica)Familiarity with DevOps practices such as CI/CD pipelines, test-drivendevelopment, etc.Strong written and verbal communicationKeys to success in this position:Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, ambiguous, highly collaborative environmentEagerness to learn independentlyAbility to challenge the status quoJob LevelWilling to consider applicants at multiple job levels.LocationThis team is primarily located in our corporate headquarters in Des Moines,IA but are considering remote applicants.How we hireOnce you apply, your application is reviewed by our talent team. Generallywithin a few weeks, the team makes interview selection decisions andcommunicates those via email.If selected, you\'ll receive an email fromPrincipal Talent Team to complete a pre-recorded interview on your own time.Be sure to check your email frequently and follow the steps shared to submittiLearn more about our and find answers to frequently asked questions.Additional InformationWork Authorization/SponsorshipAt this time, we\'re not', 'Minneapolis;NC -Charlotte;MI;IA']

['', 'We are passionate about creating memorable experiences for our fans and the best in class experience for our employees. Vivid Seats offers competitive compensation levels, individual and team-based bonus opportunities, 401K matching, a generous benefits package and Flex PTO policy plus a variety of workplace perks.\xa0', 'What We Offer:\xa0', 'As a\xa0Senior Data Engineer,\xa0you will\xa0maintain a holistic view of the Vivid Seat’s data architecture with an understanding of how it relates to the systems that depend upon it. You’ll partner with engineering teams to create data models and assist in designing our transactional data stores. This includes designing and building data systems and automated processes\xa0for our\xa0underlying cloud infrastructure and deployment pipelines.\xa0You’ll mature operational stability of the data platform through best practices, automation and monitoring while staying up to date on new and emerging technologies, planning accordingly to incorporate valuable concepts to enhance our data schema and capabilities.\xa0', 'At Vivid Seats, you will have the opportunity to work with the flexibility and speed of a startup; while operating at massive, profitable scale. We keep our teams lean, allowing each employee direct accountability of creating a positive ticket buying experience. We are relentless and move quickly to release new features and content to our applications. Good ideas are heard and implemented, and hard work rewarded. Being a part of our team means having the ability to drive impact and own the innovation that connects our tens of millions of unique monthly users to the memorable experiences that only live events create.\xa0\xa0', 'Senior Data Engineer,\xa0', 'Additional Experience of Interest:', '\xa0', 'Experience with continuous integration, testing, and deployment using tools such as\xa0Jenkins\xa0', 'Experience with containerization such as Docker\xa0', 'Experience with\xa0configuration as\xa0code tools such as Ansible, Terraform etc.\xa0', 'The Opportunity:\xa0', 'A willingness to participating in an on-call rotation\xa0', '111 N Canal Suite #800\xa0\xa0', 'Cloud experience with either GCP, AWS or Azure and experience running data platforms within a cloud environment\xa0', 'Expert knowledge of a relational database platform such as MySQL, Postgres, Oracle or SQL Server\xa0', 'This position will start remotely.', '\ufeffLocation:\xa0', 'Chicago, IL 60606\xa0\xa0', '\ufeffLocation', 'What We Offer:', 'ETL pipeline and tooling experience\xa0', 'Coding and scripting experience using Java, Python or Bash\xa0', 'To be successful, you’ll need:\xa0', 'Additional Experience of Interest:\xa0', 'Experience with\xa0configuration as\xa0code tools such as Ansible, Terraform etc.\xa0Experience with containerization such as Docker\xa0Experience with continuous integration, testing, and deployment using tools such as\xa0Jenkins\xa0', 'Experience in either modeling transaction or data warehousing with an interest in learning both methodologies\xa0', 'Vivid Seats is the largest independent online ticket marketplace, sending tens of millions of fans to live events. Experiences Matter - which is why we continue to grow year over year. Working at Vivid Seats puts you front and center at the opportunity to scale our best in class platform that allows our fans to sit closer and experience more.\xa0\xa0', 'Expert knowledge of a relational database platform such as MySQL, Postgres, Oracle or SQL Server\xa0Experience in either modeling transaction or data warehousing with an interest in learning both methodologies\xa0ETL pipeline and tooling experience\xa0Coding and scripting experience using Java, Python or Bash\xa0Proficiency in working in a Linux environment\xa0Cloud experience with either GCP, AWS or Azure and experience running data platforms within a cloud environment\xa0A willingness to participating in an on-call rotation\xa0', 'To be successful, you’ll need:', 'Proficiency in working in a Linux environment\xa0', ':\xa0', 'The Opportunity:', 'This position will start remotely.\xa0', 'Location']

['', '3+ years of Python development experience.', 'You are self-motivated, work independently, and have direct experience with all aspects of the software development lifecycle, from design to deployment. Our free personal finance app is utilized by over two million users, helping them track over $840 billion of their personal finances, all in one place. Our award-winning apps paved the way for our advisory firm, which now manages over $12 billion in personalized investment portfolios for American families. We are seeking individuals with a real passion for problem solving and a drive for continuous improvement. Distinguishing characteristics will include curiosity, innovation, and the ability to adapt quickly in a dynamic environment.', 'Primary responsibilities of this position are to help in the design, development, implementation, configuration, integration, and support of the various technology tools used by Portfolio Management teams. This includes working closely with a diverse group of veteran portfolio teams and research analysts to understand their needs and translating those into solutions.', 'Building relationships with internal business partners and vendors', 'Our culture of winning behaviors exemplifies our dedication to clients every single day. Delivering investment results enables us to distribute over 40% of our dividends—or more than $1.5 billion since 2000—to the Stowers Institute for Medical Research, a 550-person, non-profit biomedical research organization with a controlling interest in American Century Investments. Our dividend payments provide ongoing financial support for the Institute’s work of uncovering the causes, treatments and prevention of life-threatening diseases, like cancer.', 'Software Engineer ', 'Knowledge of formal application development methodologies', 'You will be a key player on an application development team that works closely with Fixed Income Portfolio Management and Research/Analyst teams to provide technology solutions', 'Knowledge of the financial services industry, including financial securities, mutual funds, and ETFs', 'For more information, please visit americancentury.com.', 'Our Firm', 'Investment management, investment operations, or a financial systems background', 'Closely follow enterprise architecture guidelines and application life cycle standards and procedures', 'You will work with sophisticated data sets to provide solutions with an emphasis on scalability and analytic robustness', 'You, as part of a team, will provide on call support and occasional overtime may be required', 'Knowledge of market data providers like Bloomberg, FactSet, Refinitiv', 'You have knowledge of project management & Agile methodologies, especially Scrum and Kanban', 'Experience building applications using CI/CD pipeline', 'American Century Investments® is a leading global asset manager with over 60 years of experience helping investors achieve their financial goals. ['', 'Develop and execute test cases, scripts, plans and procedures to support various development methodologies;', 'About The Opportunity', 'Conduct formal QA processes and apply existing QA best practices and methodologies to design, implement and automate processes;', 'Act as point of contact for QA aspects of releases, test estimations, test strategy, implementation and services.', 'About Illuminate Education', 'Design, develop conduct quality assurance of customized enterprise-level educational software for K-12 clients using web-based test management systems that facilitate software QA such as qTest, issue tracking systems such as Jira, and portable framework for testing web applications such as Selenium;', 'Job Duties:', 'Work with cross-functional teams (product management, development and support) to develop mature test integration strategies, prioritize assignments and address and resolve risks/issues and work with external QA resources to ensure successful delivery with high quality;', 'Experience: 3 years K-12 domain experience UI/Compatability testing, Defect/Bug Tracking, testing strategies and coverages, test cycles and QA of scanning solutions using WPF and OMR technologies and web applications, skills set: qTest, C#, HTML, jQuery, JavaScript, CSS, Java, Servlets, ASP.Net, AJAX, MS Access, VB, SQL, Bugzilla, Selenium, Confluence, Jira, Trello, TeamWork, Apache Jmeter and Blazemeter, test cycles: Unit, Regression, Functional, Systems, Stress & Scale, Smoke & Sanity', 'Conduct load and stress testing on software applications for analyzing and measuring the performance of a variety of services on web applications by using Apache JMeter and Blazemeter.', ' Design, develop conduct quality assurance of customized enterprise-level educational software for K-12 clients using web-based test management systems that facilitate software QA such as qTest, issue tracking systems such as Jira, and portable framework for testing web applications such as Selenium; Conduct load and stress testing on software applications for analyzing and measuring the performance of a variety of services on web applications by using Apache JMeter and Blazemeter. Develop and execute test cases, scripts, plans and procedures to support various development methodologies; Establish metrics and develop new tools and processes to ensure quality goals are met; Work with cross-functional teams (product management, development and support) to develop mature test integration strategies, prioritize assignments and address and resolve risks/issues and work with external QA resources to ensure successful delivery with high quality; Conduct formal QA processes and apply existing QA best practices and methodologies to design, implement and automate processes; Act as point of contact for QA aspects of releases, test estimations, test strategy, implementation and services. Education: BS Computer or Telecommunications Engineering, or related field or foreign equivalent Experience: 3 years K-12 domain experience UI/Compatability testing, Defect/Bug Tracking, testing strategies and coverages, test cycles and QA of scanning solutions using WPF and OMR technologies and web applications, skills set: qTest, C#, HTML, jQuery, JavaScript, CSS, Java, Servlets, ASP.Net, AJAX, MS Access, VB, SQL, Bugzilla, Selenium, Confluence, Jira, Trello, TeamWork, Apache Jmeter and Blazemeter, test cycles: Unit, Regression, Functional, Systems, Stress & Scale, Smoke & Sanity', 'Establish metrics and develop new tools and processes to ensure quality goals are met;', 'Education: BS Computer or Telecommunications Engineering, or related field or foreign equivalent']

['', 'Knowledge of advanced internet route selection protocols - an advantage', 'Like most of the world, we are working remotely these days, so communication skills—both verbal and written—are critical. This role will be filled in our Metro-Denver headquarters (in Louisville, CO) or in Metro-Boston. For the right candidate, we will consider making this a completely remote position.', 'Participate in sales conference calls and prospect visits, providing product demonstrations in person and via Zoom, and working with prospects at both a technical and business level to show how ThreatX solutions can provide value to them.', 'Knowledge in application development (ASP, .NET, PHP, JSP) – an advantage', 'Experience with cloud solutions such as Google Cloud, AWS and/or an Azure.', 'Participate in sales conference calls and prospect visits, providing product demonstrations in person and via Zoom, and working with prospects at both a technical and business level to show how ThreatX solutions can provide value to them.Possess demonstrable skills in customer-centric selling and a proven track record using it to help drive revenue.\xa0Participate as a technical resource at trade shows and conferences, when needed.Work independently and as a vital member of a sales team.Work with the sales team to strategize on sales approaches to develop business.Ensure successful on-site product evaluations and post sale installations when necessary.\xa0Identifying and gaining agreement with prospects on success criteria for trial evaluationsPlan, manage and execute customer product pilots.', 'Must have experience with Linux', 'Possess a solid understanding of web applications, database, security, and auditing environments', 'Must have knowledge of TCP/IP, HTTP, Load balancers, proxies and firewalls', 'Able to effectively present technical material to small and large groups', 'The ideal candidate must have a strong technical background, a demonstrated ability to understand and interpret prospective customer requirements and deliver customized product demonstrations to match customer needs. ', 'Working directly with the Chief Strategy Officer and other members of the Sales and Engineering team the position’s primary role is to support a growing customer base.', 'Work with the sales team to strategize on sales approaches to develop business.', '5+ years of experience in cyber security, application development, penetration testing, pre-sales engineering, or real world use of database and/or web application solutions; preferably with 2+ of these as a sales engineer and experience working in a start-up and vendor environment', 'Compliance standards knowledge (PCI, SOX, HIPAA) – an advantage', 'RESPONSIBILITIES:', 'QUALIFICATIONS:', 'The Senior Sales Engineer, will be responsible for assisting to sell ThreatX solutions and grow our client base. This involves performing the necessary needs assessment and analysis to clearly define the business objectives and capabilities and demonstrating how those requirements are supported using ThreatX products.', 'At ThreatX were proud of our technology, and of our startup culture. The right candidate will need exemplary skills, a strong work ethic and intrinsic motivation to thrive here. If you love what you do and want to join a team of people who are changing the world of application and API protection, drop us a resume.', 'Experience with both automated and manual testing and penetration testing tools – a significant advantage', 'Work independently and as a vital member of a sales team.', '5+ years of experience in cyber security, application development, penetration testing, pre-sales engineering, or real world use of database and/or web application solutions; job_title: Software Engineer in Test, Platform Services
job_text: ['', ' Ideally proficient with Python, Flask and collaborative tools like Git ', ' Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience desired ', ' Ability to work remotely and desire to make an impact at a start-up ', ' Collaborate with product and engineering teams across the company to build new features or update existing ones at scale. ', ' Debug production and test environment issues across multiple levels of the stack. ', ' Excellent communication skills, a team player with a ‘winning as a team’ attitude ', ' Champion good habits (development techniques, security, tech debt balance, TDD, and agile habits) within your team; improve testing standards, tooling, and processes. ', '  Live by and champion our values: #day-one, #ownership, #empathy, humility.   Be part of a team working closely with other engineers and product managers in rolling out enhancements and new features across ReCharge.   Build out automation frameworks and observability features to help integrate automated tests seamlessly into current development processes.   Measure and enhance reliability, availability, and throughput of core platform services serving millions of customers.   Drive quality across the team by constantly building easy-to-use test frameworks and empowering developers to move towards test driven development (TDD).   Work with real world problems faced in scaling the business, suggest innovations, enhancements and work with the team in implementing and rolling them out.   Collaborate with product and engineering teams across the company to build new features or update existing ones at scale.   Champion good habits (development techniques, security, tech debt balance, TDD, and agile habits) within your team; improve testing standards, tooling, and processes.   Debug production and test environment issues across multiple levels of the stack.  ', ' Live by and champion our values: #day-one, #ownership, #empathy, humility. ', ' Some experience with automation frameworks ', ' Strong computer science fundamentals - data structures and algorithms ', ' Experience with build tools like: Jenkins, CircleCI, or GitLab ', ' Drive quality across the team by constantly building easy-to-use test frameworks and empowering developers to move towards test driven development (TDD). ', ' Work with real world problems faced in scaling the business, suggest innovations, enhancements and work with the team in implementing and rolling them out. ', 'What You’ll Bring', ' Measure and enhance reliability, availability, and throughput of core platform services serving millions of customers. ', ' Knowledge of one or more languages like: Python, Ruby, Go, Nodejs ', ' Be part of a team working closely with other engineers and product managers in rolling out enhancements and new features across ReCharge. ', 'What You’ll Do', ' Typically, 4-6 years of relevant systems testing and feature development experience in fast paced environments. ', 'Overview', ' Build out automation frameworks and observability features to help integrate automated tests seamlessly into current development processes. ', '  Typically, 4-6 years of relevant systems testing and feature development experience in fast paced environments.   Knowledge of one or more languages like: Python, Ruby, Go, Nodejs   Ideally proficient with Python, Flask and collaborative tools like Git   Some experience with automation frameworks   Experience with build tools like: Jenkins, CircleCI, or GitLab   Experience with messaging systems like: RabbitMQ or Kafka   Self driven; a passion for taking ownership of your work and delivering outcomes   Ability to work remotely and desire to make an impact at a start-up   Excellent communication skills, a team player with a ‘winning as a team’ attitude   Strong computer science fundamentals - data structures and algorithms   Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience desired  ', ' Self driven; a passion for taking ownership of your work and delivering outcomes ', ' Experience with messaging systems like: RabbitMQ or Kafka ']

We treat our fellow employees like friends and family, and the company like our own home. As a Data Engineer on the Tandem Data Science Team, you will use cloud technology to develop robust data pipelines and operationalize machine learning models and algorithms. This team member will use Tandem’s data assets to solve data-driven problems at scale, improve operational efficiency through forecasting and automation, and improve business outcomes.', 'Attends industry and academic conferences to keep up to date with the state of technology.']

['', '- We offer an attractive compensation package including competitive salaries, bonuses, medical and dental coverage, flexible schedule & PTO, and tuition assistance', 'STILMAN Advanced Strategies- Senior Software Engineer, Front End', 'STILMAN Advanced Strategies', 'Modeling & SimulationGIS & MappingMercurial, Git, SVNCI/CD, Jenkins, SeleniumDocker and KubernetesJava, C++ and other languagesAngularUI BootstrapLeafletCesiumGruntSVGsJsonixBrowser CompatibilityFont AwesomeMilitary concepts and tactics', 'JavaScript, HTML, CSS', 'You will take part in design of new UI/UX for new features or redesigning existing ones based on customer needs and feedback, implementation of front end software using Angular, Bootstrap, Leaflet, and Cesium, performance optimization, work with backend COA-generation software developers on APIs, data representation and protocols, help model military concepts in software, as well as work with 3rd party software developers to find best ways to integrate our systems.', 'Leaflet', 'Great Experience to Have', '\xa0', 'Angular & AngularJS\xa0JavaScript, HTML, CSSBootstrap SCSSPerformance OptimizationData Structures and Algorithms', 'The Team', 'Modeling & Simulation', 'SVGs', 'Benefits &\xa0Other', 'Docker and Kubernetes', 'Browser Compatibility', 'Angular & AngularJS\xa0', 'Bootstrap SCSS', 'Key Experience to Have', 'GIS & Mapping', 'Java, C++ and other languages', '-\xa0US Citizenship\xa0is required with no dual.\xa0This position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance after you start (we will pay for and process)', 'Mercurial, Git, SVN', 'Font Awesome', "We are a small team that's distributed throughout United States and work 100% remote, with some possible travel to customer sites. The software developers are self-motivated and able to work independently, but collaborate closely with each other to take advantage of each other's strength and help where help is needed. All aspects of our work are collaborative rather than stove piped into narrowly defined roles.", 'Performance Optimization', 'STILMAN Advanced Strategies\xa0develops software based on Linguistic Geometry (LG), a unique Artificial Intelligence (AI) approach. Our core technology generates predictive, tactically correct Courses of Action (COAs) that dynamically adapt in response to changes in missions and actions taken by the intelligent opposition. These tools support mission planning, rehearsal, training and execution use cases for military commanders across echelons and services. Our applications have been shown to deliver unique value to the warfighter due to the quality of generated COAs, UX/UI design that makes it easy to fully comprehend complex COA results and to define mission inputs, as well as ease of deployment and integration with other system with well-defined modern APIs.', 'CI/CD, Jenkins, Selenium', 'Military concepts and tactics', 'Cesium', 'Data Structures and Algorithms', 'Grunt', 'Jsonix', 'AngularUI Bootstrap', '-\xa0Contact rick@stilman-strategies.com for more info. No CTC or 3rd parties please. Thanks for considering STILMAN Advanced Strategies for your next career move!\xa0', 'We are looking to bring on an additional Senior Software Engineer to focus on the primary user interface (GUI, UI) in Angular and AngularJS - web app that leverages modern UI technologies, UX concepts, GIS/mapping, communications protocols, data formats, and military concepts. This web app encompasses a large feature set for map-centric scenario construction and editing, 2D and 3D animated visualization, real time collaboration, analytics, integration with other UI and backend systems. Yet we make sure that the user experience for both basic and advanced users is as smooth as possible, little training is needed, and the officers can intuitively use the tool to help them think about tactics rather than spending their time thinking about how to use the tool.']

['', 'Significant experience working with cross functional software development teamsComfortable navigating large code bases and building distributed systemsShipped and iterated on major software components in your professional career, the open source community, and/or side projectsWrite robust, well tested, and well designed code that frequently gets deployed to users', 'We believe careful deployment of modern technology to solve hard problems in government will create extraordinary positive change for our society, and we seek teammates who want to be part of our mission.', 'Significant experience working with cross functional software development teams', 'Our plaftorm has been used to protect children and victims of human trafficking, diffuse organized crime networks, de-escalate hostage scenarios, solve homicide cases, identify serial burglary suspects, and more. Customers use the same platform to facilitate Freedom of Information responses, provide targeted social services for homeless populations, and share data with their community.', 'Write robust, well tested, and well designed code that frequently gets deployed to users', 'About You:', 'About Us:', 'Passion for crafting and shipping software solutions that delight users', 'Excellent technical vision with the ability to synthesize product requests into strong and reliable software components', 'Comfortable navigating large code bases and building distributed systems', 'Shipped and iterated on major software components in your professional career, the open source community, and/or side projects', 'Strong best practices in modern software development such as deployments, CI/CD, data management, and distributed systems', 'Strong understanding of architecture and scaling large software systemsStrong best practices in modern software development such as deployments, CI/CD, data management, and distributed systemsExcellent technical vision with the ability to synthesize product requests into strong and reliable software componentsPassion for crafting and shipping software solutions that delight usersDriven and self-disciplined with the ability to own projects from start to finish', 'The Backend Software Engineer Role:', 'As part of being a backend engineer, you’ll use a variety of programming languages and technologies to scale our platform to handle terabytes of data being ingested across a variety of data sources.\xa0You will work on a wide range of complex challenges, including building a sophisticated sharing model, processing streams of data from multiple sources, efficiently notifying users on data matching specified criteria, and optimize queries to serve search results quickly. Our stack is constantly evolving but based on the foundations of Python, Django, Celery, Airflow, PostgreSQL, Elasticsearch, Neo4J, AWS, Terraform, and Ansible.', 'What We Look For:', 'We are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We celebrate diversity and are a proud equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.', 'Our team is advised by leading experts and industry practitioners in the law enforcement, intelligence, and civil liberties sectors who help us develop technology that is both operationally effective and trust-enhancing. We believe data can be used to empower all members of society, whether they are officers, detectives, agents, attorneys, or citizens.\xa0', 'We create technology to help governments transform the way they fight crime while building trust with their communities. We do this through openness, accountability, careful policy enforcement, and respect for people’s personal freedoms.', 'Our Team:', 'Strong understanding of architecture and scaling large software systems', 'We are a team of principled and curious entrepreneurs who are motivated by solving hard problems. We trust each other, help each other, and love diving into challenges together. We believe perseverance, curiosity, creativity, humble ethos, and world-class execution are key ingredients to building impactful software.', 'Driven and self-disciplined with the ability to own projects from start to finish', 'We are inspired to work hand-in-hand with public servants. Our customers are our partners; we listen to their needs, learn from their experiences, and develop effective software experiences to help them do their best work.', 'We are looking for strong developers to join our small but growing team. As one of the earliest engineering hires, you’ll take on a lead role with vast ownership across one of our stacks.\xa0We are tackling challenging and important problems, and need engineers who can operate well in ambiguity and come to a great solution.', 'As an engineering team, we believe strongly that empathy improves our solutions. Seeing\xa0people use the product is a priority and the way we get to the right answer. Engineers will have the opportunity to work closely with our team onsite to understand the variety of use-cases that we serve. We value strong ownership on our team, while also being highly collaborative and always seeking input and feedback.', 'Our platform fuses disconnected, unstructured data across secure networks and empowers users with highly intuitive interfaces to search, analyze, and collaborate. Customers tell us we help them solve cases that they thought were unsolvable, and allow them to communicate in ways they have never seen before. We are particularly proud to help government agencies solve more crimes while averting wrongful arrests.']

['', 'At Strata our mission is to accelerate the impact of precision medicine for patients with cancer.', "Empathy: You meet users where they're at; if they're frustrated, then you're frustrated.Pragmatism: Technologies are important, but the problems you're solving are primary. That means soliciting opinions (and offering yours), never hesitating to help out, and prioritizing what's right for the patient, Strata, Informatics, and yourself (in that order).", 'Our DNA', 'Within engineering, we believe that small teams have asymmetric impact and that agile really does mean individuals and interactions over processes and tools. Value isn't delivered until it's in the customers' hands. That means soliciting opinions (and offering yours), never hesitating to help out, and prioritizing what's right for the patient, Strata, Informatics, and yourself (in that order).", "What You'll Do", 'We welcome a brief cover letter with your resume submission. Tell us about yourself.', 'Development of Strata’s ordering and results portal', 'Core development experience in a language like Python, Ruby, Go, JavaScript.', 'The Strata Informatics team is responsible for all these systems, overseeing Strata’s interactions with several dozen healthcare partners.', 'Development of Strata’s ordering and results portalIntegration, analysis, and reporting of data received from Strata’s partnersCreation and maintenance of internal tools used throughout the companyIntegrations with electronic medical record (EMR) systems (e.g. Epic, Cerner)', 'With Ann Arbor roots and employees around the country, this is a phenomenal place to make an impact and move fast. We also have fun and support employees in their learning including paid conference attendance.', 'Technical Chops', "We're hiring an experienced full-stack software engineer for our Informatics team.", '\ufeffPeople Skills, We Have People Skills', 'We’re looking for talented, proactive people who are driven to help others, fulfill the promise of precision medicine for cancer patients, and cultivate their career path along the way. If you enjoy collaborating with inspiring teammates, creating and supporting products that really make a difference, we want you.', 'Strata Oncology is an Equal Opportunity Employer.', 'Creation and maintenance of internal tools used throughout the company', 'Join us, challenge your career and skills, be rewarded, and make an impact on something that matters–the lives of cancer patients.', 'This team is responsible for:', "Empathy: You meet users where they're at; if they're frustrated, then you're frustrated."]

['', 'Rapidly growing global data intelligence firm seeks Senior Data Infrastructure Engineer.\xa0The Data Infrastructure is the factory that converts hundreds of sources of raw data on small and medium businesses (SMBs) into actionable intelligence for decision makers to provide credit, insurance and other services to SMBs.\xa0In today’s environment, where millions of SMBs in the United States are struggling, their mission has never been more important. The team synthesizes billions of records from hundreds of different data sources, identifies common businesses in these billions of records (entity resolution) and runs dozens of calculators to extract signal on each business’ growth, health and continuity risk.', 'Entity resolution is a hard problem and they’re continuously tuning our algorithms and experimenting with new methods. Data freshness and accuracy are critical.\xa0We maintain reliability and quality while operating at a large scale. The world is always changing--They’re continuously adding new data sources and calculators to provide better intelligence on SMBs', '-Reflexively tests and measures your results', 'We’re looking for someone who:', '-You will be building and extending a sophisticated data pipeline with predictive models embedded at multiple stages.\xa0You’ll need to simultaneously balance system reliability, rigorous data quality requirements and an ambitious forward development plan.', '-Is driven to unlock the potential of data to positively impact the real world', '-Thrives on small, focused and highly collaborative teams', '-Prides yourself on writing highly readable, thoroughly tested code (we use PySpark)', 'You will work on:', '-The Data Infrastructure team has solved many problems.\xa0And yet there are more open questions than closed ones.\xa0We love people who bring new ideas and show us how to make our data more powerful.', '-Knows Spark inside and out.\xa0Optimizing Spark code and cluster configuration is second nature.\xa0You can quickly reason about and diagnose unexpected issues.', '-Constantly questions how things are done and use evidence to convince people to try different approaches']

['', 'Position Requirements', 'Physical Requirements', 'Knowledge, Skills, Abilities:', '\xa0Learn the scientific requirements for the 12 GeV program, including experimental applications with an emphasis on data acquisition transport technologies.', "You 'Matter to Us'\xa0Our diverse team at Jefferson Lab includes more than 700 people, comprising physicists, engineers, computer professionals, technicians and more. From probing the basic building blocks of matter to performing advanced computing and applied research, we are on the leading edge of science and technology. If you are looking for a great job in a unique place where your contributions truly matter, consider Jefferson Lab!", 'Essential Job Functions:\xa0', '\xa0', 'Strong background in Linear Algebra, Probability and Statistics, Data Structure and Algorithms. Proficient in Python and C/C++.', 'Demonstrated knowledge of network programming models. General understanding of multiple techniques and toolkits is needed.Strong background in Linear Algebra, Probability and Statistics, Data Structure and Algorithms. Proficient in Python and C/C++.Must possess good written and oral communication skills.Must be able to operate computer equipment in an office or laboratory environment.', 'Ability to understand, remember, and communicate highly technical information and make decisions\xa0Ability to understand complex problems and to collaborate, explore and implement alternative solutions\xa0Capable of analytic and deductive reasoning\xa0', 'Plan, coordinate, and complete large projects.', 'Education and Experience:', 'Jefferson Science Associates, LLC (JSA) manages and operates the Thomas Jefferson National Accelerator Facility (Jefferson Lab). JSA is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in hiring or employment on the basis of race, color, religion, ethnicity, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, or veteran status or on any other basis prohibited by federal, state, or local law. As part of the JSA’s equal employment opportunity policy, we also take affirmative action as called for by applicable laws and Executive Orders to ensure that minority group individuals, females, disabled veterans, recently separated veterans, other protected veterans, Armed Forces, and qualified disabled persons are introduced into our workforce and considered for promotional opportunities.', 'Visual capabilities to use computer workstations, read documents, and see safety alarms\xa0', 'Employment with JSA is conditional upon DOE approval if at any time during your employment you are participating in a Foreign Government Talent Recruitment Program. Generally, such programs include any foreign-state-sponsored attempt to acquire U.S.-funded scientific research through programs run or funded by the government that target scientists, engineers, academics, researchers, and entrepreneurs of all nationalities working or educated in the United States.', 'Ability to work at a computer workstation for extended periods\xa0', 'Capable of analytic and deductive reasoning\xa0', 'Ability to understand, remember, and communicate highly technical information and make decisions\xa0', 'Ability to traverse across various locations on the laboratory site and access work areas\xa0Ability to work at a computer workstation for extended periods\xa0Visual capabilities to use computer workstations, read documents, and see safety alarms\xa0', 'We are currently seeking a Streaming Data Scientist..\xa0', 'Must possess good written and oral communication skills.', 'Ability to traverse across various locations on the laboratory site and access work areas\xa0', 'Jefferson Lab seeks a new team member at the level of a Staff Computer Scientist III for the Experimental Physics Software and Computing Infrastructure (EPSCI) group in the Computational Science and Technology (CST) division. As a member of EPSCI, the candidate will help develop systems utilizing the latest software, computing, and networking technologies to help advance the scientific program of the lab. We are seeking excellent candidates with knowledge/experience in streaming data transport to design and implement systems to meet the challenges of future scientific experiments to match computational resources to their larger size and scope. These include the 12GeV Experimental Nuclear Physics program currently underway and future science programs under development. The successful candidate will focus on research activities and developing data transport tools for streaming readout data acquisition systems as well as post-acquisition data processing. Duties will include working with scientists at Jefferson Lab and partner institutions to develop such tools and provide expert advice on their implementation. Applicants must be able to work with a small group of subject matter experts, have good communication skills, and relevant technical knowledge.', 'Collaborate with universities and other DOE Labs to advance and support the scientific program at Jefferson Lab.', 'Mental Requirements', 'Plan, coordinate, and complete large projects.\xa0Learn the scientific requirements for the 12 GeV program, including experimental applications with an emphasis on data acquisition transport technologies.Lead and assist in the design and development of data transport and related systems to support the 12 GeV program , EIC design work, and future science programs.Collaborate with universities and other DOE Labs to advance and support the scientific program at Jefferson Lab.Experience in HTC preferred.\xa0Proficiency in C/C++, Java, and Python are a plus.', 'Demonstrated knowledge of network programming models. General understanding of multiple techniques and toolkits is needed.', 'Experience in HTC preferred.\xa0Proficiency in C/C++, Java, and Python are a plus.', 'Lead and assist in the design and development of data transport and related systems to support the 12 GeV program , EIC design work, and future science programs.', 'Ph.D. in Computer Science or Physical Sciences plus 10 years of relevant experience', 'SALARY RANGE: $103,200 - $163,200 (SS III)', 'Ability to understand complex problems and to collaborate, explore and implement alternative solutions\xa0', 'Must be able to operate computer equipment in an office or laboratory environment.', 'POSITION POSTED: AUGUST 11, 2020']

['', ' CSS Accessibility Design Systems Tooling and frontend infrastructure (e.g. webpack, Babel, TypeScript, or Codemods) ', 'Beyond mentoring engineers, actually upleveling engineers. We believe in investing in each other and identifying opportunities for our coworkers to stretch themselves and lead.', "Leading technical projects from problem definition all the way through rollout. You'll work with product managers, designers, other engineers, and your customers (for this role it's our Operations team) to develop solutions to some of Pilot's most interesting problems.", 'Writing clean, well-tested code — mostly frontend, but we love the full stack! — to accomplish team and company goals.', 'Tooling and frontend infrastructure (e.g. webpack, Babel, TypeScript, or Codemods)', 'Design Systems', 'Have multiple years of experience working in component-based frontend frameworks (e.g. Vue, React, Angular, or similar). We are a Vue.js shop, but most of us learned Vue at Pilot! Experience with other technologies will translate well to our stack.', 'Mentoring high potential engineers on your team (and potentially other teams) to help them develop their skills, i.e. teaching them new concepts, performing useful code reviews, and giving feedback or guidance.', 'Have a demonstrated ability to drive foundational improvements for your company, product, or team.', 'CSS', "Demonstrate a commitment to fostering an inclusive work environment, with awareness of the challenges marginalized people face in tech. We are a diverse team representing a variety of identities and experiences, and we're supportive of each other's needs.", 'Authoring, contributing to, and/or overseeing the creation of technical specs and testing/rollout plans.', 'About Us', "Show general programming fluency in at least one language. Our application logic is written in Python, but we'll happily accept experience in a comparable language.", 'Accessibility', 'Participating in product and design reviews to provide your technical perspective on the features we want to build.', " Leading technical projects from problem definition all the way through rollout. You'll work with product managers, designers, other engineers, and your customers (for this role it's our Operations team) to develop solutions to some of Pilot's most interesting problems. Participating in product and design reviews to provide your technical perspective on the features we want to build. Authoring, contributing to, and/or overseeing the creation of technical specs and testing/rollout plans. Writing clean, well-tested code — mostly frontend, but we love the full stack! — to accomplish team and company goals. Mentoring high potential engineers on your team (and potentially other teams) to help them develop their skills, i.e. teaching them new concepts, performing useful code reviews, and giving feedback or guidance. Beyond mentoring engineers, actually upleveling engineers. We believe in investing in each other and identifying opportunities for our coworkers to stretch themselves and lead. Working across teams to shape frontend development at Pilot (e.g. defining best practices, choosing technologies, evolving our tech stack). Shadowing and interacting with the Operations team and other stakeholders who use the Pilot app on a daily basis. ", " Show general programming fluency in at least one language. Our application logic is written in Python, but we'll happily accept experience in a comparable language. Have multiple years of experience working in component-based frontend frameworks (e.g. Vue, React, Angular, or similar). We are a Vue.js shop, but most of us learned Vue at Pilot! Experience with other technologies will translate well to our stack. Have a demonstrated ability to drive foundational improvements for your company, product, or team. Have experience mentoring, sponsoring, and upleveling engineers you've worked with on previous teams. Demonstrate a commitment to fostering an inclusive work environment, with awareness of the challenges marginalized people face in tech. We are a diverse team representing a variety of identities and experiences, and we're supportive of each other's needs. ", 'upleveling', 'Working across teams to shape frontend development at Pilot (e.g. defining best practices, choosing technologies, evolving our tech stack).', "Have experience mentoring, sponsoring, and upleveling engineers you've worked with on previous teams.", 'About You', 'Shadowing and interacting with the Operations team and other stakeholders who use the Pilot app on a daily basis.']

['Do you dream in entity relationship diagrams? Think you can stump the CTO with an SQL question — and would you like to work someone where the CTO wants you to be smarter than they are?', '', 'ICX is building a world-class data practice, and we’re looking for expert database engineers to help us achieve our ambitious goals. We have embraced Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and are building batch and streaming workflows atop it using Dataflow (Apache Beam), Cloud Run, CloudSQL (PostgreSQL) and BigQuery, orchestrated using Cloud Composer (Apache Airflow). Our preferred languages are Python and Golang. We are seeking candidates with strong relational modeling and SQL knowledge, skills, and experience. If you’re an engineer that wants to concentrate in data engineering or an experienced data scientist that is interested in making a move to the engineering side, this may be a great opportunity for you.', 'The ICX data engineering team has embraced a remote-first approach to working and has members that span Eastern to Pacific time zones. This opportunity is open to US citizens and legal permanent U.S. residents who are authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship.']

['', 'Essential Functions', ' Develop run books and documentation to detail all data infrastructure design and operations, including backup and recovery. ', ' Identify, evaluate, and implement infrastructure solutions for unified business intelligence, data warehousing, scaling and parallel processing, and machine learning ', ' Collaborate with the peer Engineering team to ensure data quality and to advise on the design and implementation of system integrations and API services. ', ' Migratory Bird Initiative, a multi-year project to track and aggregate varied data sources about migratory bird species, where they go, and the threats they face ', ' Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, Mathematics, or related quantitative field strongly preferred. ', ' Familiarity with machine learning/data science platforms and services like Sagemaker, Domino, TensorFlow, etc. a plus. ', ' 7 years of experience as a Data Engineer, or in similar roles, with increasing levels of responsibility. ', ' Take ownership of building and maintaining the new data infrastructure, including data platforms, data pipelines, and analytical and business intelligence tools. ', ' Integrate data from multiple sources (e.g., email, website interactions, CRM and volunteer activity, voter files, demographic data to support inclusion and equity metrics) into a data warehouse and building optimized views and workflows for analysis, reporting, and dashboard visualization ', ' Genuine passion for conservation and the mission of the National Audubon Society.', ' Work with the VP of Data and Analytics and the Director of IT to support data governance initiatives and to ensure the reliability and security of data services and infrastructure. ', ' Advise on the design, build, and maintenance of structured databases to track curated data such as bird species taxonomies, bird-friendly native plants by geolocation, and important bird areas, along with product and engineering staff ', 'Position Summary', ' Contribute to the design of a new strategic data infrastructure to support the National Audubon Society mission.  Take ownership of building and maintaining the new data infrastructure, including data platforms, data pipelines, and analytical and business intelligence tools.  Develop run books and documentation to detail all data infrastructure design and operations, including backup and recovery.  Collaborate with the Enterprise Geographic Information Systems (GIS) team to leverage enterprise GIS and mapping technologies as part of the overall data architecture.  Advise the VP of Data and Analytics, as well as others throughout the organization, on data-related tools and platforms, data best practices for integrity, testing, and modeling, and analytical approaches.  Collaborate with the peer Engineering team to ensure data quality and to advise on the design and implementation of system integrations and API services.  Work with the VP of Data and Analytics and the Director of IT to support data governance initiatives and to ensure the reliability and security of data services and infrastructure. ', ' Migratory Bird Initiative, a multi-year project to track and aggregate varied data sources about migratory bird species, where they go, and the threats they face  Integrate data from multiple sources (e.g., email, website interactions, CRM and volunteer activity, voter files, demographic data to support inclusion and equity metrics) into a data warehouse and building optimized views and workflows for analysis, reporting, and dashboard visualization  Identify, evaluate, and implement infrastructure solutions for unified business intelligence, data warehousing, scaling and parallel processing, and machine learning  Proactive data analysis to identify issues and implement a plan to improve the quality and integrity of operational data, particularly constituent data across data-heavy systems like Salesforce and EveryAction  Advise on the design, build, and maintenance of structured databases to track curated data such as bird species taxonomies, bird-friendly native plants by geolocation, and important bird areas, along with product and engineering staff  Convert raster data of predictive bird species ranges based on climate change models to vector features to enable enterprise GIS analysis and further conservation research ', ' Demonstrated ability to communicate technical information to non-technical audiences. ', ' Experience with or strong understanding of ETL/ELT and workflow tools like AWS Glue and Apache Airflow. ', ' Experience with business intelligence tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker, PowerBI). ', ' Experience supporting data science notebook environments such as Jupyter Hub or R Studio preferred. ', ' Experience building data architectures that support web application such as RESTful web services. ', ' Experience with or strong understanding of big data architectures and data modeling to efficiently process large volumes of data, including solutions like Spark, Hadoop, EMR, Kafka, etc. ', ' Convert raster data of predictive bird species ranges based on climate change models to vector features to enable enterprise GIS analysis and further conservation research ', 'Overview', ' Fluency in Linux-based operating systems. ', ' Experience with cloud data warehouse solutions like Redshift, Snowflake, Azure Data Warehouse, and/or BigQuery. ['This role will be responsible for expanding our data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross-functional teams. The ideal candidate is an experienced data pipeline builder and data wrangler, who enjoys optimizing data systems and building them from the ground up.\xa0This position will support our software developers, database architects, data analysts, and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects.\xa0The successful candidate will: · Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture; · Assemble large, complex data sets that meet both functional and non-functional business requirements; · Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.; · Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and AWS ‘big data’ technologies; · Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency and other key business performance metrics; · Collaborate with stakeholders including the executive, product, data and design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs; · Create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader; · Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems. A successful Data Engineer will have: · A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science Engineering, Data Analytics, or a related technical degree.\xa0Technical requirements: · Five+ years of experience working with distributed data technologies (e.g. Hadoop, MapReduce, Spark, Kafka, Flink etc) for building efficient, large-scale ‘big data’ pipelines; · Strong Software Engineering experience with proficiency in at least one of the following programming languages: Golang, Java, Python, Scala or equivalent; · Implement data ingestion pipelines both real time and batch using best practices; · Experience with building stream-processing applications using Apache Flink, Kafka Streams or others; · Experience with Cloud Computing platforms like Amazon AWS, Google Cloud etc.; · Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment; · Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including Postgres and Cassandra. · Ability to work in a Linux environment. Ideal qualifications: · Experience in building distributed, high-volume data services; · Experience with big data processing and analytics stack in AWS: EMR, S3, EC2, Athena, Kinesis, Lambda, Quicksight etc.']
